content: acorns terminology this is a no sew/ low sew pattern the only sewing is to close up the final row chain chain the seed and stem are worked in a spiral the cap is slip_stitch slip_stitch worked as a slip_stitch to the previous stitch followed by single_crochet single_crochet stitch double_crochet double_crochet stitch a chain s do not crochet into the slip_stitch space it is increase two single_crochet stitches in one stitch not a stitch and does not count towards your stitch brackets __ ×# repeat the sequence within the count brackets as many times as the number it s multiplied by if you don t want a textured cap you can replace all double_crochet double_crochet & single_crochet an increase consisting of a double_crochet stitches with single_crochet stitches followed by a single_crochet in the same stitch space single_crochet & double_crochet an increase consisting of a single_crochet followed by a double_crochet in the same stitch space single_crochet/double_crochet decrease a decrease starting with a single_crochet in the first stitch and ending with a double_crochet in the second stitch do not use an invisible decrease we want to build up a texture on the cap this decrease is made as follows ➢ -insert hook into the first stitch ➢ -yarn over ➢ -pull up ➢ -yarn over ➢ -insert hook into the second stitch ➢ -yarn over ➢ -pull up ➢ -yarn over ➢ -pull through two loops ➢ -yarn over ➢ -pull through remaining three loops materials 3mm hook 4 yards of light brown worsted weight yarn 5 yards of dark brown worsted weight yarn small amount of fibre fill darning needle scissors pattern stitch count row 1 starting with light brown yarn single_crochet 4 into a magic_ring 4 row 2 increase ×4 8 row 3 increase single_crochet ×4 12 row 4 single_crochet increase single_crochet ×4 16 row 5-7 single_crochet 16 3 row 16 per row 48 total row 8 single_crochet 16 slip_stitch in next stitch fasten_off the light brow yarn 16 row 9 attach dark brown yarn to the front loop of the next stitch continuing in the front loops only 24 single_crochet double_crochet & single_crochet double_crochet single_crochet & double_crochet ×4 slip_stitch to first stitch chain 2 row 10 double_crochet single_crochet ×12 slip_stitch to first stitch chain 1 24 row 11 single_crochet/double_crochet decrease ×12 slip_stitch to first stitch chain 1 12 note stuff with enough fibre fill to maintain shape it doesn t need a lot just enough to not cave in on itself when you squeeze the sides row 12 single_crochet/double_crochet decrease ×6 slip_stitch to first stitch chain 1 6 row 13 in the back loops only single_crochet 6 continue in spiral 6 row 14 single_crochet 6 slip_stitch to next stitch 6 note fasten_off with enough yarn to sew the end closed pinch and roll the stem in your
